io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi

Class Aurora

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi.NanoleafDevice
      • io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi.Aurora

  • public class Aurora
extends NanoleafDevice
    The Aurora class is one of the three main concrete classes for creating a NanoleafDevice. This class should only be used to connect to physical Aurora devices. For other devices such as the Canvas or Hexagons, use the Canvas and Shapes classes, respectively.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class io.github.rowak.nanoleafapi.NanoleafDevice

    • Constructor Detail

      • Aurora

        public Aurora(String hostname,
              int port,
              String accessToken)
       throws NanoleafException,
              IOException
        Creates a new instance of the Aurora.
        Parameters:
        hostname - the hostname of the Aurora
        port - the port of the controller (default=16021)
        accessToken - a unique authentication token
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • Aurora

        public Aurora(String hostname,
              int port,
              String accessToken,
              NanoleafCallback<Aurora> callback)
        Asynchronously creates a new instance of the Aurora.
        Parameters:
        hostname - the hostname of the Aurora
        port - the port of the Aurora (default=16021)
        accessToken - a unique authentication token
        callback - the callback that is called when the device has been initialized
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

    • Method Detail

      • isRhythmConnected

        public boolean isRhythmConnected()
                          throws NanoleafException,
                                 IOException
        Indicates if the Rhythm is connected to the Aurora or not.
        Returns:
        true, if the Rhythm is connected
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • isRhythmConnectedAsync

        public void isRhythmConnectedAsync(NanoleafCallback<Boolean> callback)
                            throws NanoleafException,
                                   IOException

        Asynchronously indicates if the Rhythm is connected to the Aurora or not.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - returns true, if the Rhythm module is connected, or false if it is not connected
        Throws:
        NanoleafException
        IOException

      • isRhythmMicActive

        public boolean isRhythmMicActive()
                          throws NanoleafException,
                                 IOException
        Indicates if the Rhythm's microphone is currently active or not.
        Returns:
        true, if the Rhythm is active
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • isRhythmMicActiveAsync

        public void isRhythmMicActiveAsync(NanoleafCallback<Boolean> callback)

        Indicates if the Rhythm's microphone is currently active or not.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - returns true, if the Rhythm microphone is active, or false if it is not active

      • getRhythmId

        public int getRhythmId()
                throws NanoleafException,
                       IOException

        the Rhythm's ID as an integer
        Throws:

        IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • getRhythmIdAsync

        public void getRhythmIdAsync(NanoleafCallback<Integer> callback)

        Asynchronously indicates the ID of the Rhythm module in the Aurora system.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - returns the ID of the Rhythm module

      • isRhythmAuxAvailable

                             throws NanoleafException,
                                    IOException
        Indicates if an aux cable (3.5mm) is currently connected to the Rhythm.

      • isRhythmAuxAvailableAsync

        public void isRhythmAuxAvailableAsync(NanoleafCallback<Boolean> callback)

      • getRhythmMode

        public int getRhythmMode()
                  throws NanoleafException,
                         IOException
        Allows the user to control the sound source for the Rhythm. Mode 0 is the microphone. Mode 1 is the aux (3.5mm) cable.
        Returns:
        the Rhythm mode (0 or 1)
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • getRhythmModeAsync

        public void getRhythmModeAsync(NanoleafCallback<String> callback)

        Asynchronously allows the user to control the sound source for the Rhythm. Mode 0 is the microphone. Mode 1 is the aux (3.5mm) cable.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        callback - returns the Rhythm mode (0 or 1)

      • setRhythmMode

        public void setRhythmMode(int mode)
                   throws NanoleafException,
                          IOException
        Writing 0 to this field sets the Rhythm's sound source to the microphone, and writing 1 to the field sets the sound source to the aux cable.
        Parameters:
        mode - the Rhythm mode (0 or 1 only)
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid, or the mode is not either 0 or 1
        IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • setRhythmModeAsync

        public void setRhythmModeAsync(int mode,
                               NanoleafCallback<String> callback)

        Writing 0 to this field sets the Rhythm's sound source to the microphone, and writing 1 to the field sets the sound source to the aux cable.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Parameters:
        mode - the Rhythm mode (0 or 1 only)
        callback - called when the Rhythm mode is changed or when an error occurs

      • getRhythmPanel

        public Panel getRhythmPanel()
                     throws NanoleafException,
                            IOException
        Indicates the position and orientation of the Rhythm in the Aurora's layout.
        Returns:
        the Rhythm module panel
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

      • getRhythmPanelAsync

        public void getRhythmPanelAsync(NanoleafCallback<Panel> callback)

        Asynchronously indicates the position and orientation of the Rhythm in the Aurora's layout.

        Parameters:
        callback - returns the Rhythm panel
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        IOException - If an HTTP exception occurs

        Overrides:
        enableExternalStreamingAsync in class NanoleafDevice

      • sendStaticEffectExternalStreaming

        public void sendStaticEffectExternalStreaming(StaticEffect effect)
                                       throws NanoleafException,
                                              IOException

        Sends a series of frames to the target device.

        Note:Requires external streaming to be enabled. Enable it using the NanoleafDevice.enableExternalStreaming() method.

        Overrides:
        sendStaticEffectExternalStreaming in class NanoleafDevice
        Parameters:
        effect - the custom effect to be sent to the device
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        IOException - If an I/O exception occurs
        SocketException - If the target device cannot be found or connected to

      • sendStaticEffectExternalStreamingAsync

        public void sendStaticEffectExternalStreamingAsync(StaticEffect effect,
                                                   NanoleafCallback<String> callback)

        Asynchronously sends a series of frames to the target device.

        Note:Requires external streaming to be enabled. Enable it using the NanoleafDevice.enableExternalStreaming() method.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Overrides:
        sendStaticEffectExternalStreamingAsync in class NanoleafDevice
        Parameters:
        effect - the custom effect to be sent to the device
        callback - called when the effect is sent or when an error occurs

      • setPanelExternalStreaming

        public void setPanelExternalStreaming(int panelId,
                                      int red,
                                      int green,
                                      int blue,
                                      int transitionTime)
                               throws NanoleafException,
                                      IOException
        Description copied from class: NanoleafDevice
        Updates the color of a single panel.
        Overrides:
        setPanelExternalStreaming in class NanoleafDevice
        Parameters:
        panelId - the id of the panel to update
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        transitionTime - the time to transition to this frame from the previous frame (must be 1 or greater)
        Throws:
        NanoleafException - If the access token is invalid
        IOException - If an I/O exception occurs
        SocketException - If the target device cannot be found or connected to

      • setPanelExternalStreamingAsync

        public void setPanelExternalStreamingAsync(int panelId,
                                           int red,
                                           int green,
                                           int blue,
                                           int transitionTime,
                                           NanoleafCallback<String> callback)
        Description copied from class: NanoleafDevice

        Asynchronously updates the color of a single panel.

        The callback status will return NanoleafCallback.SUCCESS on success, or NanoleafCallback.UNAUTHORIZED if the access token is invalid. If an internal API error occurs, it will instead return NanoleafCallback.FAILURE.

        Overrides:
        setPanelExternalStreamingAsync in class NanoleafDevice
        Parameters:
        panelId - the id of the panel to update
        red - the red RGB value
        green - the green RGB value
        blue - the blue RGB value
        transitionTime - the time to transition to this frame from the previous frame (must be 1 or greater)
        callback - called when the panel color changes or when an error occurs
